Part of the Ministry of Education

Individual and collective prevention and health promotion for all schoolchildren

Welcoming and supporting each pupil according to their specific needs, particularly in terms of their physical or mental health: individualised reception plans (PAI) and personalised care plans (PPS)

question.title: What is the main focus of school medicine?
question.description: School medicine is a branch of healthcare that focuses on the health and well-being of schoolchildren.

option_a.title: Preventing diseases and promoting healthy habits
option_a.description: Preventing diseases and promoting healthy habits is a key aspect of school medicine.

option_b.title: Providing individualized medical care to each student
option_b.description: Providing individualized medical care to each student is a key aspect of school medicine.

option_c.title: Screening for orthopaedic, visual, hearing, and dental abnormalities
option_c.description: Screening for orthopaedic, visual, hearing, and dental abnormalities is an important part of school medicine.

option_d.title: Focusing on the health and well-being of all schoolchildren
option_d.description: Focusing on the health and well-being of all schoolchildren is the main goal of school medicine.
